It is a non-vascular plant characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form dense, cushion-like structures. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, called sporophytes, develop on the upper surface of the leafy stems. Phlegmariurus ascendens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
